::Prowl::

Prowl speeds up toward IR. He knew that the battlefield was no place
for comforting, but it was no place for sulking either. He catches up
to her.

"Hey, I'm sorry," he says, trying to reason with her, "I didn't mean
to think that. But look at the CF, its not gonna live through this
battle."


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Iron didn't stop.
> < Go away.>
> It felt like no one cared, not even Prowl.
> All they cared about was that stupid city, ripping up the ship she'd
called 
> home and none of them cared.
> She had never hand a home and just when she had tried to settle in
and was 
> feeling comfortable there they had to tare it down.
> No one cared.
> But why did she expect them to?
> She sighed.
> < Gotta be something to do with this body. Maybe that so called PMS
or 
> something.>
> She lied to herself.  But she was commander and even though that was
just a 
> name and meant nothing, she thought thst she would at least mean
something.*
> 
> 
>
